subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Dust Bowl
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Dust Bowl.

hook.text: In the 1930s, the American Great Plains turned to dust. Farms blew away in the wind.

buildup.text: Farmers had plowed up deep-rooted prairie grass, leaving bare soil exposed to the wind.

discovery.text: When drought hit, there was nothing to hold the topsoil. Black blizzards buried entire towns.

twist.text: Dust storms reached New York and Washington, D.C. â€” darkening skies 2,500 km away.

climax.text: 2.5 million people fled the plains. It was the largest migration in American history.

punchline.text: The land gave everything it had. Then the wind took it.

quiz.question: What human action worsened the Dust Bowl?
